channel.title: [317]-Server Help-[317]
channel.description:
Heres the problem i run my 317 server for a few mins and everyone can connect then it shows that im offline when i check my online statues on *removed* i dont know what the problem is i turn the server on for 5 mins & a few mins later it goes offline & the people that were on the server stay on it & no one else can connect after it goes offline any help please?
[ul][li]Heres Whats In My Run.Bat[/li][/ul]
[code]@echo off COLOR 01 title Server java -Xmx512m -cp .;./jython.jar;./MySql/mysql-connector-java-3.0.17-ga-bin.jar server[/code]
Any Solutions please & i want to stay on this source i dont want a nother one.

item.title: [317]-Server Help-[317]
item.dc:creator: @IceTICKER IceTICKER
item.description:
@IceTICKER wrote:

[quote=“kneistol, post:18, topic:301325”]restart all of your computers at your home and get the fuck a new source NOW!

and then i think it will work[/quote]

The thing is i dont need a new source this source is one of the oldest ones i know & its stable but i just keep getting that error & i think there is a program with port 43594 if this helps i got that port open on my linksys & utorrent & my firewall exceptions but i unstalled utorrent i thought that was the problem

Read full topic

item.description:
@im_hard wrote:

It means to port is already in use, so your already using a program with the port 43594

item.title: [317]-Server Help-[317]
item.dc:creator: @IceTICKER IceTICKER
item.description:
@IceTICKER wrote:

Server Is Fine & After A Few Minutes it says

[ul][li]Error: Unable To StartUp Listener On 43594 - Port Already In Use[/li][/ul]

I dont understand this anymore The Server Is On but it doesint allow anymore connections after this error pops up .

Read full topic

item.title: [317]-Server Help-[317]
item.dc:creator: @I_Hawk_I I Hawk I
item.description:
@I_Hawk_I wrote:

hmm very strange… Well I suppose try checking some things over in the files that are appearing in the error? also… if you changed anything in your client.java server.java or the Server configuration settings file… and do some searches and make sure all ports are set to “43594” otherwise im not sure. Yet again try and search for some other applications that may be using the port aswell… but apologies if none of the things I have said have helped, it was the first thing that came to mind when I saw your problem… sorry that I cant help much more :\

Read full topic

Here is some work i did when some of you explained this to me,;

Port 43594

Changeing the Port ; To Random"

Better Picture of me doing it.

Starting up Run.Bat

Inside The Run.Bat

Putting the port back to 43594

Congradulations it didint work

Sorry about all the pictures its just me explaining how i did all of that.

Read full topic

item.title: [317]-Server Help-[317]
item.dc:creator: @I_Hawk_I I Hawk I
item.description:
@I_Hawk_I wrote:

As Others have said already - The Port that you are using, in this case 43594 is currently being used by another application - I would first point fingers at either, you already have the server on and have forgot to close it before re-running it OR I would expect this is to do with uTorrent as its a simple thing I forget to do time to time, simply open uTorrent and press either ctrl-P or go into options and click preferences, then go onto the “connection” section and look under “listening port” Now check your Port that is used for incoming connections. If it says 43594 copy this, then click “random port” - Apply - Start your server - then go back on uTorrent paste the 43594 back where it was before and apply. This should tackle the problem IF this is whats causing it… if not then youll have to check other applications and which ports they are using.

Read full topic

item.title: [317]-Server Help-[317]
item.dc:creator: @ownagesbot ownagesbot
item.description:
@ownagesbot wrote:

Telenim stop talking shit you fucked up cunt.

The error message is clear, the port is already in use. Find out what application is using it and end that application. It’s most likely another instance of the server, that you shutdown without unbinding from the port. Try going to taskmanager and shutting all java.exe instances.

Read full topic

item.description:
@baselm wrote:

if u r using utorrent, exit from it, run ur server, then reopen it.
thats all, or else , the server is already on

item.title: [317]-Server Help-[317]
item.dc:creator: @Telenim Telenim
item.description:
@Telenim wrote:

[quote=“IceTICKER, post:5, topic:301325”][ul][li]Error That I’m Getting Look Close[/li][/ul]

[/quote]THIS PICTURE means that the server is already online.

YOUR ERROR means that someone is either nulling the server so people that are online stay online, but cannot reconnect, or the max player limit is reached
